comment._content: See also www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2929579164/ (for some informative comments) and other Bain pictures tagged Evelyn Nesbit Thaw.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I love the epithet "The Girl on the Red Velvet Swing" from her trial testimony.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See also www.loc.gov/rr/news/topics/stanfordwhite.html Topics in Chronicling America - The first "trial of the century" the murder of Stanford White "The information and sample article links below provide access to a sampling of articles from historic newspapers that can be found in the Chronicling America: American Historic Newspapers digital collection (http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/). Use the Suggested Search Terms and Dates to explore this topic further in Chronicling America."

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The notorious Red Velvet Swing was in one of Stanford White's apartments. According to trial testimony, White forced Evelyn Nesbit to sit naked in the swing, while he pushed it. Amazingly, Evelyn lived to be a consultant on the making of the Hollywood movie, The Girl In The Red Velvet Swing (1955). www.prairieghosts.com/thaw.html

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: There is a sketch of Evelyn Nesbit Thaw that people might enjoy on the front page of The evening world. (New York, N.Y.) 1887-1931, January 18, 1908, Final Results Edition. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030193/1908-01-18/ed-...
